explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1673(o-,m-,p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 560degC (ICSC,2004).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 62-63degC (ICSC,2004), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 204mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 204mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999)), 650mg/kg (IARC 16 (1978)) and 280mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 1,100mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild to moderate irritation" from rabbit skin irritation tests (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999)). Also based on the description of human health effects (ACGIH (7th, 2001), CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999) and MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "skin irritant."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999)): "conjunctival injection and corneal opacity were observed." Also based on the description of human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)): "irritating to the eye." The substance is thus considered an eye irritant (though the severity of the effects is unknown). It should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999)): "Skin sensitization: positive." Also CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999), PATTY (4th, 1999) and MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) contain descriptions that indicate a potential to cause skin sensitization in humans. Also due to the fact that the substance is classified into "Skin Sensitizing Substance" by the ad hoc committee of the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy and "Skin Sensitizing Substance: Group 1" by the Japan Society for Occupational Health.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 98-29 (1999) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Group 3 by IARC (1987).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of minor anomaly in filial generation at doses inducing maternal toxicity, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "airway edema" (IUCLID (2000)) and the evidence from animal studies including "acute pulmonary edema following dermal exposure" (RTECS (2004)), "clonic convulsion" and "cyanosis" (IUCLID (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1. However, as the referenced study is rated as Priority 2, which does not meet the specified criterion 1b (iii), the substance is classified as Category 2 in accordance with the technical guideline.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, liver, kidney, urinary bladder), Category 2 (cardiovascular system, blood system, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, liver, kidney, urinary bladder) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (cardiovascular system, blood system, respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "abnormal reflex, hyperesthesia of the skin, pathological changes on the kidneys and liver," "death from sub-acute hepatatrophy with jaundice" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "fibrosis in the lung, thickening of finger skin," "reflux esophagitis, leg edema, bradycardia, cardiac block, sclerodactylia, dilatation of peripheral vessels of fingers, fibrosis in the lung, esophageal dilatation," "death from hepatatrophy with jaundice" (IUCLID (2000)), "mucosal edema of the bladder, polypous swelling, cellular infiltration (eosinophilic leukocyte) in the bladder triangle area and cervix" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "increased degeneration of the liver accompanied by pyknosis of hepatocytes" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), "sedation, methemoglobinemia" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "damage to the liver and central nervous system" (IUCLID (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=2.0mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2001) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=24(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 2%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
